main event: An elliptical object was observed in Spokane, Washington on 20 August 1951.
interesting points: The object was estimated to be approximately 30-60 feet in diameter and was silver or aluminum in color., The object was visible for approximately 2-3 minutes during which it made no noise and left no trail or exhaust., Observers estimated the object's speed to be between 500-600 miles per hour during an 80-90 degree climb., The observation distance was about 2-3 miles, with no other aircraft seen in the vicinity., The case was ultimately evaluated as a balloon.
witness description: neither observer professed much knowledge of aircraft but could identify various types of aircraft that fly over the area.
